name: Port Rekka
role_in_state: primary seaport, shipbuilding and reagent transshipment hub
culture_adjustments: stronger guild authority and court customs than inland towns
higher tolerance for foreign crews and Island Creole lingua franca
ritual navigation practices visible in daily work (portable auguries)
constraints: limited heavy combustion industry (no high-pressure steam works)
ritual magic dependent on scarce imported reagents
harbour expansion constrained by reefs and tidal channels
notes: key transshipment point for state-wide ritual reagents
guilds control berth allocation and chart-licensing
seasonal monsoon windows restrict safe sailings
